There are currently 4 levels of abortion laws throughout the nation.

 Level 4: Abortions are legal with limited to no restrictions up to childbirth. Meaning someone could have an abortion deep into their 3rd trimester. 18 states practice this, including New York and California 

 Level 3: Abortions are legal up to birth with limited restrictions which could be parental involvement, a 24 hours waiting period, or the restriction of government funds. 

 Level 2: Abortions are legal until about 21 weeks. With 1 or 2 restrictions. These restrictions could be parental notifications, lack of government funding, 24 or 72 hour waiting period, insurance restrictions.

 Level 1: Abortions are legal until 20 weeks. With similar restrictions to level 2 but normally have 3 or 4 of them.
